Reviews.Title: “No TEMPUR beds”
Reviews.Author: jpalomag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, well situated, clean, brand new, quiet, with a berlin wall memorial just round the corner and very kind employees. I was thoroughly disappointed by the fact that the only reason I booked the hotel was that they stated they had tempur beds in all their rooms and what I found was the cheapest mattress I've ever seen and a terrible back pain the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - good quality”
Reviews.Author: JasmineD2
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a few days at the Grenzfall. It was our first time to stay here - and we were very impressed: large, clean, comfortable rooms; friendly, competent staff; and a wonderful garden at the back. [We'd recommend you ask for a garden-view room.] Very good location too: a few stops on the U-bahn into town; a short walk along Ackerstr. towards Hackescher Markt; and a few stops on the 10 tram to Prenzlauer Berg. Also try renting bikes from the hotel [only €10 for the day]. Breakfast is extra, which was the only downside: it might be worth skipping this and having breakfast elsewhere. Otherwise, however, full marks to the Grenzfall: we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel-would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Twintraveler3
Reviews.Content: The tourist info at the Berlin train station booked us here. Lovely large rooms with a clean modern design. Staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke English. Best feature was the stunning garden in the back of the hotel.....only downside was breakfast was extra. The hotel is a "integrationshotel" which means they hire people with physical and mental disabilities. The hotel is also wheelchair accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: read_and_listen
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, located immediately next to where the Berlin Wall used to run. Rooms are well furnished, with a simple elegance. Beds are comfortable. The rooms overlook either a large garden or a small street without through traffic, and are very quiet. Reception staff is friendly, competent and multi-lingual. The hotel restaurant, which fronts on the garden -- some tables are available outside -- has a good selection of well-prepared meals at modest prices; service was friendly and quick. The breakfast buffet was ample and tasty, if a bit pricey at 11 €. A kiosk with coffee and snacks is just outside the hotel. Connections: a stop on the Metro Tram line 10 is just around the corner, and it is 10 minutes' walk to the S-Bahn station Nordbahnhof (2 minutes by tram). is 10 minutes' .
